title: Proverbs 1:1
content: 1 The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, the king of Israel:

title: Proverbs 1:2
content: 2 To know wisdom and instruction, to understand sayings of understanding;

title: Proverbs 1:3
content: 3 to receive instruction of insight, righteousness and justice and integrity;

title: Proverbs 1:4
content: 4 to give to naive ones prudence, to a young man knowledge and discretion

title: Proverbs 1:5
content: 5 (a wise one will hear and increase learning, and the understanding one will acquire directions),

title: Proverbs 1:6
content: 6 to understand a proverb and a satire, the words of the wise ones and their riddles.

title: Proverbs 1:7
content: 7 The fear of Yahweh {is} the beginning of knowledge, fools despise wisdom and instruction.

title: Proverbs 1:8
content: 8 Hear, my son, the instruction of your father and do not forsake the law of your mother.

title: Proverbs 1:9
content: 9 For, they {are} a garland of grace for your head and pendants for your neck.

title: Proverbs 1:10
content: 10 My son, if sinners entice you, do not consent.

title: Proverbs 1:11
content: 11 If they say, “Come with us! Let us lie in wait for blood. Let us hide to ambush the innocent one without cause.

title: Proverbs 1:12
content: 12 Let us swallow them, the living ones, like Sheol, and the whole ones like those going down to a pit.

title: Proverbs 1:13
content: 13 We will find all precious wealth. We will fill our houses {with} spoil.

title: Proverbs 1:14
content: 14 You must cause your lot to fall in our midst; one purse will be for all of us.”

title: Proverbs 1:15
content: 15 My son, do not walk in the way with them; restrain your foot from their path.

title: Proverbs 1:16
content: 16 For their feet run to evil, and they hurry to pour out blood.

title: Proverbs 1:17
content: 17 Surely in vain {is} the net spread out in the eyes of any owner of wing,

title: Proverbs 1:18
content: 18 but they lie in wait for their blood; they hide in ambush for their lives.

title: Proverbs 1:19
content: 19 So {are} the paths of all who unjustly gain unjust gain; it takes the life of its owner.

title: Proverbs 1:20
content: 20 Wisdom cries out outside, she gives her voice in the open areas.

title: Proverbs 1:21
content: 21 At the head of the tumultuous places she calls out; at the opening of the gates in the city, she says her sayings,

title: Proverbs 1:22
content: 22 “Until when will naive ones love naiveté and mockers delight {in} mockery for themselves and stupid ones hate knowledge?

title: Proverbs 1:23
content: 23 Turn to my rebuke. Behold, I shall allow my spirit to gush forth to you, I shall cause you to know my words.

title: Proverbs 1:24
content: 24 Because I have called and you have refused, I have stretched out my hand and there was no one listening attentively,

title: Proverbs 1:25
content: 25 and you have ignored all my counsel, and my rebuke you did not accept,

title: Proverbs 1:26
content: 26 I too shall laugh at your calamity, I shall mock when your dread comes,

title: Proverbs 1:27
content: 27 when your dread comes like a storm and your calamity happens like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.

title: Proverbs 1:28
content: 28 Then they will call out to me, but I will not answer. They will diligently seek me, but they will not find me,

title: Proverbs 1:29
content: 29 for the reason that they hate knowledge and the fear of Yahweh they did not choose,

title: Proverbs 1:30
content: 30 they did not want my counsel, and they despised my every rebuke.

title: Proverbs 1:31
content: 31 And they will eat from the fruit of their way, and from their plans they will be satisfied.

title: Proverbs 1:32
content: 32 For the turning away of the naive ones will slay them and {false} security will lead stupid ones to ruin.

title: Proverbs 1:33
content: 33 But the one who listens to me will dwell securely and will be at ease from the dread of evil.”

title: Proverbs 2:1
content: 1 My son, if you receive my sayings, and my commandments you store up with you,

title: Proverbs 2:2
content: 2 to cause your ear to be attentive to wisdom, incline your heart to understanding—

title: Proverbs 2:3
content: 3 indeed, if for understanding you call out, for perception you lift up your voice,

title: Proverbs 2:4
content: 4 if you seek it like silver and like hidden treasures you search for it,

title: Proverbs 2:5
content: 5 then you will understand the fear of Yahweh and the knowledge of God you will find.

title: Proverbs 2:6
content: 6 For Yahweh gives wisdom, from his mouth {are} knowledge and understanding.

title: Proverbs 2:7
content: 7 And he stores up for the upright ones sound wisdom; a shield for those walking {with} integrity,

title: Proverbs 2:8
content: 8 to guard the paths of justice, and the way of his faithful ones he will preserve.

title: Proverbs 2:9
content: 9 Then you will understand righteousness and justice and integrity—every good track.

title: Proverbs 2:10
content: 10 For wisdom will enter into your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.

title: Proverbs 2:11
content: 11 Discretion will watch over you, understanding will guard you,

title: Proverbs 2:12
content: 12 to rescue you from the way of evil, from a man who speaks perverse things,

title: Proverbs 2:13
content: 13 the ones who forsake the paths of straightness to walk in the ways of darkness,

title: Proverbs 2:14
content: 14 the ones who are glad to do evil, they rejoice in perverse things of evil,

title: Proverbs 2:15
content: 15 whose paths {are} crooked and who go astray in their tracks;

title: Proverbs 2:16
content: 16 to rescue you from a strange woman, from a foreign woman who makes her sayings smooth,

title: Proverbs 2:17
content: 17 the one who forsakes the companion of her youth, and the covenant of her God, she has forgotten.

title: Proverbs 2:18
content: 18 For her house sinks down to death and her tracks to the spirits of dead ones.

title: Proverbs 2:19
content: 19 All those who enter her will not return and they will not reach the paths of life.

title: Proverbs 2:20
content: 20 So you shall walk in the way of the good ones and the paths of the righteous ones you shall keep.

title: Proverbs 2:21
content: 21 For the upright ones will dwell {in} the land, and the blameless ones will remain in it,

title: Proverbs 2:22
content: 22 but wicked ones will be cut off from the land, and the treacherous ones will be torn away from it.

title: Proverbs 3:1
content: 1 My son, do not forget my law, and my commandments let your heart guard.

title: Proverbs 3:2
content: 2 For length of days and years of life and peace, they will add to you.

title: Proverbs 3:3
content: 3 Do not let covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness leave you, tie them on your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart,

title: Proverbs 3:4
content: 4 and find favor and good insight in the eyes of God and man!

title: Proverbs 3:5
content: 5 Trust in Yahweh with all your heart and on your understanding do not lean.

title: Proverbs 3:6
content: 6 In all your ways acknowledge him, and he himself will straighten your paths.

title: Proverbs 3:7
content: 7 Do not be wise in your eyes; fear Yahweh and turn away from evil.

title: Proverbs 3:8
content: 8 It will be healing for your navel and refreshment for your bones.

title: Proverbs 3:9
content: 9 Honor Yahweh from your wealth and from the first of all your produce,

title: Proverbs 3:10
content: 10 and your storehouses will be filled with plenty, and with new wine, your wine vats will burst open.

title: Proverbs 3:11
content: 11 The correction of Yahweh, my son, do not reject, and do not abhor his rebuke.

title: Proverbs 3:12
content: 12 For whom Yahweh loves, he rebukes, and like a father, a son he is pleased with.

title: Proverbs 3:13
content: 13 Happy {is} a man who finds wisdom and a man who obtains understanding.

title: Proverbs 3:14
content: 14 For better {is} its profit than the profit of silver, and than gold its produce.

title: Proverbs 3:15
content: 15 She is more precious than corals, and all your desired things do not compare with her.

title: Proverbs 3:16
content: 16 Length of days {is} in her right hand, in her left hand {are} riches and honor.

title: Proverbs 3:17
content: 17 Her ways {are} ways of pleasantness and all her beaten paths {are} peace.

title: Proverbs 3:18
content: 18 She {is} a tree of life to the ones who take hold of her, and those who grasp her {are} happy.

title: Proverbs 3:19
content: 19 Yahweh by wisdom founded the earth, he established the heavens by understanding.

title: Proverbs 3:20
content: 20 By his knowledge the depths broke open and the clouds dripped dew.

title: Proverbs 3:21
content: 21 My son, do not let them depart from your eyes, guard prudence and discretion;

title: Proverbs 3:22
content: 22 and they will be life for your soul and grace for your neck.

title: Proverbs 3:23
content: 23 Then you will walk your way to security and your foot will not stumble.

title: Proverbs 3:24
content: 24 If you lie down, you will not be in dread, and you will lie down, and your sleep will be pleasant.

title: Proverbs 3:25
content: 25 Do not be afraid of sudden dread and of the devastation of the wicked ones when it comes.

title: Proverbs 3:26
content: 26 For Yahweh will be your confidence, and he will keep your foot from capture.

title: Proverbs 3:27
content: 27 Do not withhold good from its owners, when it is in the power of your hand to act.

title: Proverbs 3:28
content: 28 Do not say to your neighbor, “Go and return, and tomorrow I will give {it},” and it is with you.

title: Proverbs 3:29
content: 29 Do not plot evil against your neighbor, and he who is dwelling securely with you.

title: Proverbs 3:30
content: 30 Do not contend with a man without cause, if he has not done you evil.

title: Proverbs 3:31
content: 31 Do not be envious of a man of violence and do not choose any of his ways.

title: Proverbs 3:32
content: 32 For an abomination to Yahweh {is} he who goes astray, but with the upright ones {is} his secret counsel.

title: Proverbs 3:33
content: 33 The curse of Yahweh {is} on the house of the wicked one, but he blesses the abode of the righteous ones.

title: Proverbs 3:34
content: 34 Though to the mockers he himself mocks, yet to the humble ones he gives favor.

title: Proverbs 3:35
content: 35 Wise ones will inherit honor, but stupid ones lift up dishonor.

title: Proverbs 4:1
content: 1 Hear, sons, the instruction of a father, and listen attentively in order to know understanding.

title: Proverbs 4:2
content: 2 For I give good teaching to you; do not forsake my law.

title: Proverbs 4:3
content: 3 When I was a son of my father, the tender and only one before the face of my mother,

title: Proverbs 4:4
content: 4 then he taught me and said to me, “Let your heart grasp my words; keep my commandments and live!

title: Proverbs 4:5
content: 5 Acquire wisdom, acquire understanding; do not forget and do not veer from the sayings of my mouth.

title: Proverbs 4:6
content: 6 Do not forsake her and she will preserve you; love her and she will guard you.

title: Proverbs 4:7
content: 7 The beginning of wisdom: acquire wisdom! And with all your acquisition acquire understanding!

title: Proverbs 4:8
content: 8 Cherish her and she will raise you up; she will honor you when you embrace her.

title: Proverbs 4:9
content: 9 She will give for your head a garland of grace; {with} a crown of splendor she will cover you.”

title: Proverbs 4:10
content: 10 Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, and they will multiply for you the years of life.

title: Proverbs 4:11
content: 11 In the way of wisdom I taught you; I caused you to tread in the tracks of uprightness.

title: Proverbs 4:12
content: 12 When you walk, your step will not be restricted; and if you run, you will not stumble.

title: Proverbs 4:13
content: 13 Grasp on to instruction, do not let go; guard it, for it {is} your life.

title: Proverbs 4:14
content: 14 On the path of wicked ones do not go and do not advance on the way of evil ones.

title: Proverbs 4:15
content: 15 Avoid it, do not pass through it; veer from it and pass on!

title: Proverbs 4:16
content: 16 For they do not sleep if they do not do evil and their sleep is robbed if they do not cause stumbling.

title: Proverbs 4:17
content: 17 For they eat the bread of wickedness and the wine of violent {acts}, they drink.

title: Proverbs 4:18
content: 18 But the path of the righteous ones {is} like the light of brightness, going and shining until the day {is} established.

title: Proverbs 4:19
content: 19 The way of the wicked ones {is} like the darkness; they do not know on what they stumble.

title: Proverbs 4:20
content: 20 My son, listen attentively to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.

title: Proverbs 4:21
content: 21 Do not let them depart from your eyes; keep them in the midst of your heart.

title: Proverbs 4:22
content: 22 For they {are} life to those who find them and healing to all of his flesh.

title: Proverbs 4:23
content: 23 Guard your heart more than all {that} is protected, for from it {are} the sources of life.

title: Proverbs 4:24
content: 24 Remove from you perversity of mouth, and the deviousness of lips put far away from you.

title: Proverbs 4:25
content: 25 Cause your eyes to gaze to the front, and cause your eyelids to be straight in front of you.

title: Proverbs 4:26
content: 26 Make level the track of your foot and all your ways will be firm.

title: Proverbs 4:27
content: 27 Do not veer right or left; cause your foot to turn away from evil.

title: Proverbs 5:1
content: 1 My son, listen attentively to my wisdom, incline your ear to my understanding

title: Proverbs 5:2
content: 2 in order to keep discretion, and your lips may guard knowledge.

title: Proverbs 5:3
content: 3 For the lips of a strange woman drip fresh honey and smoother than oil {is} her palate,

title: Proverbs 5:4
content: 4 but her aftermath {is} bitter like wormwood, sharp like a sword of mouths.

title: Proverbs 5:5
content: 5 Her feet are going down {to} death; her steps take hold of Sheol.

title: Proverbs 5:6
content: 6 Lest she observe the path of life, she does not know her tracks {are} unstable.

title: Proverbs 5:7
content: 7 And now, sons, listen to me; and do not turn away from the sayings of my mouth.

title: Proverbs 5:8
content: 8 Keep your way far from her and do not come near to the opening of her house.

title: Proverbs 5:9
content: 9 Lest you give to others your splendor and your years to a cruel one.

title: Proverbs 5:10
content: 10 Lest strangers be satisfied with your strength and your toils {be} in the house of a foreigner,

title: Proverbs 5:11
content: 11 and you groan at your end when your flesh and your body are finished.

title: Proverbs 5:12
content: 12 And you will say, “How I hated correction and my heart despised rebuke!

title: Proverbs 5:13
content: 13 And I did not listen to the voice of my teachers and to my instructors, I did not incline my ear.

title: Proverbs 5:14
content: 14 I was almost in all evil in the midst of the assembly and the congregation.”

title: Proverbs 5:15
content: 15 Drink water from your cistern and flowing waters from the midst of your well.

title: Proverbs 5:16
content: 16 Should your springs overflow outside, channels of water in the open areas?

title: Proverbs 5:17
content: 17 Let them be for you, for you alone, and not for strangers with you.

title: Proverbs 5:18
content: 18 May your fountain be blessed, and be glad because of the wife of your youth!

title: Proverbs 5:19
content: 19 A doe of loves and a mountain goat of grace, may her breasts drench you on every occasion; may you continually stagger in her love.

title: Proverbs 5:20
content: 20 And why would you stagger, my son, with a strange woman, or embrace the bosom of a foreign woman?

title: Proverbs 5:21
content: 21 For in front of the eyes of Yahweh {are} the ways of a man, and all of his paths he observes.

title: Proverbs 5:22
content: 22 His iniquities capture him, the wicked one; and by the cords of his sin he is grasped.

title: Proverbs 5:23
content: 23 He will die because there is no correction; and in the abundance of his folly he staggers.

title: Proverbs 6:1
content: 1 My son, if you pledge for your neighbor, you clasp your palms for a stranger,

title: Proverbs 6:2
content: 2 you are ensnared by the sayings of your mouth, you are caught by the sayings of your mouth,

title: Proverbs 6:3
content: 3 then do this, my son, and rescue yourself: Since you have come into the palm of your neighbor, go, humble yourself, and press your neighbor.

title: Proverbs 6:4
content: 4 Do not give sleep to your eyes and slumber to your eyelids.

title: Proverbs 6:5
content: 5 Rescue yourself like a gazelle from a hand, and like a bird from the hand of the trapper.

title: Proverbs 6:6
content: 6 Go to the ant, lazy one! See its ways and be wise,

title: Proverbs 6:7
content: 7 which, without a commander, officer, or ruler for it,

title: Proverbs 6:8
content: 8 prepares its bread in the summer; it gathers its food in the harvest.

title: Proverbs 6:9
content: 9 Until when, lazy one, will you lie down? When will you rise from your sleep?

title: Proverbs 6:10
content: 10 “A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to lie down”—

title: Proverbs 6:11
content: 11 and your poverty will come like one who walks and your lack like a man of shield.

title: Proverbs 6:12
content: 12 A man of worthlessness, a man of iniquity, {is} one who walks {with} perversity of mouth,

title: Proverbs 6:13
content: 13 one who winks with his eye, one who rubs with his foot, one who points with his fingers.

title: Proverbs 6:14
content: 14 Perverse things {are} in his heart, plotting evil on every occasion; he sends forth quarrels.

title: Proverbs 6:15
content: 15 Therefore his calamity will come instantly, suddenly he will be broken and without healing.

title: Proverbs 6:16
content: 16 Six {are} they Yahweh hates, and seven {are} abominations to his self:

title: Proverbs 6:17
content: 17 uplifted eyes, a tongue of falsehood, and hands pouring out innocent blood,

title: Proverbs 6:18
content: 18 a heart devising plans of iniquity, feet hurrying to run to evil,

title: Proverbs 6:19
content: 19 a witness of falsehood who breathes out lies and who sends forth quarrels between brothers.

title: Proverbs 6:20
content: 20 Guard, my son, the commandment of your father and do not forsake the law of your mother.

title: Proverbs 6:21
content: 21 Bind them on your heart continually; tie them around your neck.

title: Proverbs 6:22
content: 22 When you walk about, it will guide you; when you lie down, it will preserve you; and you will wake up, it will converse with you.

title: Proverbs 6:23
content: 23 For the commandment {is} a lamp and the law {is} a light, and the rebukes of instruction {are} the way of life,

title: Proverbs 6:24
content: 24 to keep you from a woman of evil, from the smoothness of the tongue of a foreign woman.

title: Proverbs 6:25
content: 25 Do not desire her beauty in your heart and do not let her take you with her eyelashes.

title: Proverbs 6:26
content: 26 For the price of a prostitute woman {is} as a loaf of bread, but the wife of a man hunts a precious life.

title: Proverbs 6:27
content: 27 Could a man carry a fire on his chest and his clothes not be burned?

title: Proverbs 6:28
content: 28 If a man walks on coals then will his feet not be scorched?

title: Proverbs 6:29
content: 29 So is the one going to the wife of his neighbor: Every one who touches her will not remain blameless.

title: Proverbs 6:30
content: 30 They do not despise the thief if he steals to satisfy his appetite when he is hungry.

title: Proverbs 6:31
content: 31 But if he is found, he must repay sevenfold; all the wealth of his house he must give.

title: Proverbs 6:32
content: 32 One who commits adultery {with} a woman {is} lacking of heart; destroying his life, he does it.

title: Proverbs 6:33
content: 33 He will find a wound and disgrace and his shame will not be wiped out.

title: Proverbs 6:34
content: 34 For jealousy is the heat of a man, and he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

title: Proverbs 6:35
content: 35 He will not lift up the face of any ransom, and he will not be willing if you increase the bribe.

title: Proverbs 7:1
content: 1 My son, keep my sayings and store up my commandments with you.

title: Proverbs 7:2
content: 2 Keep my commandments and live, and my law as the pupil of your eyes.

title: Proverbs 7:3
content: 3 Tie them on your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.

title: Proverbs 7:4
content: 4 Say to wisdom, “You {are} my sister,” and call to understanding, “Kinsman,”

title: Proverbs 7:5
content: 5 in order to keep you from the strange woman, from the foreign woman who makes her sayings smooth.

title: Proverbs 7:6
content: 6 For at the window of my house, through the window lattice I looked down.

title: Proverbs 7:7
content: 7 And I saw among the naive ones, I discerned among the sons a young man lacking of heart

title: Proverbs 7:8
content: 8 passing through the lane beside her corner, and he steps {in} the way of her house,

title: Proverbs 7:9
content: 9 in the twilight breeze, in the evening of day, in the pupil of the night and darkness.

title: Proverbs 7:10
content: 10 And behold, {there is} a woman to meet him, {with} the garment of a prostitute and guarded of heart.

title: Proverbs 7:11
content: 11 (She {is} a loud and rebellious one; her feet do not stay in her house.

title: Proverbs 7:12
content: 12 At {one} time in the street, at {another} time in the open areas, and beside every corner she lies in wait.)

title: Proverbs 7:13
content: 13 And she grabs him and kisses him, she strengthens her face and says to him,

title: Proverbs 7:14
content: 14 “The sacrifices of peace offerings {are} with me; today I paid my vows.

title: Proverbs 7:15
content: 15 Therefore, I came out to meet you, to diligently seek your face, and I found you.

title: Proverbs 7:16
content: 16 I have spread my couch {with} coverings, colored linen of Egypt.

title: Proverbs 7:17
content: 17 I have sprinkled my bed {with} myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

title: Proverbs 7:18
content: 18 Come, let us be drenched {with} lusts until the morning; let us delight ourselves with loves.

title: Proverbs 7:19
content: 19 For the man is not in his house; he went on a road far away.

title: Proverbs 7:20
content: 20 He took the bag of the silver in his hand; on the day of the full moon he will enter his house.”

title: Proverbs 7:21
content: 21 She leads him astray with the abundance of her teaching; with the smoothness of her lips she compels him.

title: Proverbs 7:22
content: 22 Following after her suddenly, like an ox to slaughter he goes, and like an ankle chain to the correction of a fool,

title: Proverbs 7:23
content: 23 until an arrow splits his liver, like a bird rushing into a trap, and he did not know that it {was} for his life.

title: Proverbs 7:24
content: 24 And now, sons, listen to me; and listen attentively to the sayings of my mouth.

title: Proverbs 7:25
content: 25 Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways; do not wander into her tracks.

title: Proverbs 7:26
content: 26 For she has caused many pierced ones to fall, and numerous {are} all her slain ones.

title: Proverbs 7:27
content: 27 Her house {is} the ways of Sheol, descending to the rooms of death.

title: Proverbs 8:1
content: 1 Does not wisdom call out and understanding give her voice?

title: Proverbs 8:2
content: 2 At the head of the heights beside the road, the house of the paths, she stations herself.

title: Proverbs 8:3
content: 3 At the hand of the gates, at the mouth of the city, the entrance of the openings, she cries out.

title: Proverbs 8:4
content: 4 “To you, men, I call; and my voice {is} to the sons of man.

title: Proverbs 8:5
content: 5 Understand prudence, naive ones, and stupid ones, understand heart.

title: Proverbs 8:6
content: 6 Listen, for noble things I will speak, and the opening of my lips {will be} upright things.

title: Proverbs 8:7
content: 7 For my palate will utter truth, and wickedness {is} an abomination to my lips.

title: Proverbs 8:8
content: 8 All the words of my mouth {are} in righteousness; there is nothing twisted or crooked in them.

title: Proverbs 8:9
content: 9 All of them {are} straightforward things for the understanding one and upright things for finders of knowledge.

title: Proverbs 8:10
content: 10 Take my instruction and not silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold.

title: Proverbs 8:11
content: 11 For wisdom {is} better than corals and all desired things do not compare with her.

title: Proverbs 8:12
content: 12 I, Wisdom, I dwell with prudence, and knowledge of discretion I find.

title: Proverbs 8:13
content: 13 The fear of Yahweh {is} to hate evil. Pride and arrogance and the evil way and the mouth of perverse things I hate.

title: Proverbs 8:14
content: 14 Counsel and sound wisdom {are} mine; I {am} understanding; strength {is} mine.

title: Proverbs 8:15
content: 15 By me kings reign and dignitaries decree righteousness.

title: Proverbs 8:16
content: 16 By me princes rule, and nobles, all judges of righteousness.

title: Proverbs 8:17
content: 17 I myself love those who love me, and those who diligently seek me will find me.

title: Proverbs 8:18
content: 18 Riches and honor {are} with me, lasting wealth and righteousness.

title: Proverbs 8:19
content: 19 My fruit {is} better than gold and than refined gold, and my produce than choice silver.

title: Proverbs 8:20
content: 20 I walk in the path of righteousness, in the midst of the beaten paths of justice,

title: Proverbs 8:21
content: 21 to cause those who love me to inherit property; and their treasuries I will fill.

title: Proverbs 8:22
content: 22 Yahweh possessed me {at} the beginning of his way, before his works from then.

title: Proverbs 8:23
content: 23 From eternity I was poured out, from the head, from the ancient times of the earth.

title: Proverbs 8:24
content: 24 When there were no watery depths, I was brought forth, when there were no springs heavy with water.

title: Proverbs 8:25

content: 3 And I have not learned wisdom, nor the knowledge of holy ones do I know.

title: Proverbs 30:4
content: 4 Who has ascended {to} heaven and descended? Who has gathered the wind in the hollow of his hands? Who has wrapped waters in the cloak? Who has raised up all the ends of the earth? What {is} his name? And what {is} the name of his son? Surely you know!

title: Proverbs 30:5
content: 5 Every saying of God is refined; he {is} a shield for those who take refuge in him.

title: Proverbs 30:6
content: 6 Do not add upon his words, lest he rebuke you and you be shown a liar.

title: Proverbs 30:7
content: 7 Two things I ask from with you, do not withhold from me before I die:

title: Proverbs 30:8
content: 8 Emptiness and the word of a lie put far away from me. Do not give to me poverty or riches; cause me to receive the bread of my portion.

title: Proverbs 30:9
content: 9 Lest I be satiated, and I deny and say, ‘Who {is} Yahweh?’ And lest I become dispossessed and steal, and I seize the name of my God.

title: Proverbs 30:10
content: 10 Do not slander a slave to his master, lest he curse you, and you be found guilty.

title: Proverbs 30:11
content: 11 {There is} a generation, it curses its father and does not bless its mother.

title: Proverbs 30:12
content: 12 {There is} a generation clean in its eyes, but it is not washed from its excrement.

title: Proverbs 30:13
content: 13 {There is} a generation, how its eyes are raised up, and its eyelids are lifted up!

title: Proverbs 30:14
content: 14 {There is} a generation, its teeth {are} swords and its fangs {are} knives for devouring afflicted ones from the earth and needy ones from man.

title: Proverbs 30:15
content: 15 Two daughters {are} for the leech, ‘Give! Give!’ {There are} three, they are not satisfied; four, they do not say, ‘Enough:’

title: Proverbs 30:16
content: 16 Sheol, and the closure of the womb, a land not satisfied with water, and a fire does not say, ‘Enough!’

title: Proverbs 30:17
content: 17 An eye mocks a father and shows contempt for the obedience {to} a mother; the ravens of the valley will peck it out, and the sons of the vulture will eat it.

title: Proverbs 30:18
content: 18 Three things, they {are} too wonderful for me, and four, I do not understand them:

title: Proverbs 30:19
content: 19 the way of the eagle in the sky, the way of a snake on a rock, the way of a ship in the heart of the sea, and the way of a young man with a young woman.

title: Proverbs 30:20
content: 20 Thus {is} the way of a woman who commits adultery: She eats and wipes her mouth and says, ‘I have not done iniquity.’

title: Proverbs 30:21
content: 21 Under three things the earth quakes, and under four it is not able to hold up:

title: Proverbs 30:22
content: 22 under a slave when he becomes king and a worthless one when he is satisfied with bread,

title: Proverbs 30:23
content: 23 under a hated woman when she is married and a female servant when she dispossesses her mistress.

title: Proverbs 30:24
content: 24 Four things, they {are} small things of the earth but they {are} wise things, being made wise:

title: Proverbs 30:25
content: 25 The ants {are} a people not strong, but they prepare their food in the summer.

title: Proverbs 30:26
content: 26 Rock badgers {are} a people not mighty, but they set their house in the cliff.

title: Proverbs 30:27
content: 27 There is no king for the locust, but each of it go out divided {into groups}.

title: Proverbs 30:28
content: 28 You can catch a lizard with hands, yet it {is} in the palaces of the king.

title: Proverbs 30:29
content: 29 Three things, they are doing well of step, and four are doing well of walking:

title: Proverbs 30:30
content: 30 a lion, mighty among the animals, and it will not turn away from the face of anything,

title: Proverbs 30:31
content: 31 one girded of loins, or a male goat, and a king against whom one does not rise up.

title: Proverbs 30:32
content: 32 If you have been foolish by lifting up yourself, or if you have schemed, a hand {be} to mouth!

title: Proverbs 30:33
content: 33 For the squeezing of milk brings out butter, and the squeezing of the nose brings out blood, and the squeezing of nostrils brings out strife.”

title: Proverbs 31:1
content: 1 The words of Lemuel the king, a burden that his mother had instructed him:

title: Proverbs 31:2
content: 2 What, my son? And what, son of my womb? And what, son of my vows?

title: Proverbs 31:3
content: 3 Do not give to women your strength or your ways to cause kings to be wiped out.

title: Proverbs 31:4
content: 4 {It is} not for kings, Lemuel, {it is} not for kings to drink wine or for dignitaries or intoxicating drink.

title: Proverbs 31:5
content: 5 Lest he drink and forget what has been decreed and pervert the legal claim of all the sons of the afflicted one.

title: Proverbs 31:6
content: 6 Give intoxicating drink to the perishing one and wine to those bitter of soul.

title: Proverbs 31:7
content: 7 He will drink and forget his poverty, and his trouble he will not remember again.

title: Proverbs 31:8
content: 8 Open your mouth for a mute one, for the legal claim of all the sons of the one passing away.

title: Proverbs 31:9
content: 9 Open your mouth, judge {with} righteousness, and plead the legal case of the afflicted one and poor one.

title: Proverbs 31:10
content: 10 A woman of worth, who can find? And her value {is} far more than corals.

title: Proverbs 31:11
content: 11 The heart of her husband trusts in her, and spoil he will not lack.

title: Proverbs 31:12
content: 12 She does to him good and not evil all the days of her life.

title: Proverbs 31:13
content: 13 She searches {for} wool and linens and works with the delight of her palms.

title: Proverbs 31:14
content: 14 She is like the ships of a merchant; she brings her bread from far away.

title: Proverbs 31:15
content: 15 And she rises while still night and gives food to her house and a portion to her young women.

title: Proverbs 31:16
content: 16 She considers a field and gets it; from the fruit of her palms she plants a vineyard.

title: Proverbs 31:17
content: 17 She girds her loins with strength, and she strengthens her arms.

title: Proverbs 31:18
content: 18 She perceives that her profit {is} good; her lamp does not go out in the night.

title: Proverbs 31:19
content: 19 She stretches out her hands at the distaff, and her palms grasp the spindle.

title: Proverbs 31:20
content: 20 She spreads out her palm to the afflicted one, and she stretches out her hands to the poor one.

title: Proverbs 31:21
content: 21 She does not fear for her house because of snow, for all her house is clothed {with} crimson.

title: Proverbs 31:22
content: 22 She makes for herself coverings, fine linen and purple for her clothing.

title: Proverbs 31:23
content: 23 Her husband is known at the gates, when he sits with the elders of the land.

title: Proverbs 31:24
content: 24 She makes a linen garment and sells, and a belt she gives to the Canaanite.

title: Proverbs 31:25
content: 25 Strength and splendor {are} her clothing, and she laughs at a future day.

title: Proverbs 31:26
content: 26 Her mouth opens with wisdom, and the law of covenant faithfulness {is} on her tongue.

title: Proverbs 31:27
content: 27 She scans the goings on of her house, and the bread of laziness she does not eat.

title: Proverbs 31:28
content: 28 Her sons rise up and call her happy; her husband also praises her.

title: Proverbs 31:29
content: 29 “Many daughters have acted {with} worth, but you yourself have ascended over all of them.”

title: Proverbs 31:30
content: 30 The charm {is} falsehood and the beauty {is} vapor; a woman fearful of Yahweh, she herself will be praised.

title: Proverbs 31:31
content: 31 Give to her from the fruit of her hands and let her works praise her at the gates.
